author: Special Correspondent
text:
Desiya Murpokku Dravidar Kazhagam (DMDK) founder leader Vijayakant surrendered before Judicial Magistrate I here on Thursday in a case relating to destruction of a banner bearing the image of Chief Minister Jayalalithaa.

During a demonstration here on December 28 last, DMDK cadres removed the hoarding bearing the image of Ms. Jayalalithaa when Mr. Vikayakant was addressing the gathering.

On a complaint from Thanjavur MLA M. Rengasamy to the Thanjavur East Police who, a case was filed against 13 DMDK cadres.

Charges were also framed against nine party leaders, including Mr. Vijayakant.

While one among them was arrested, seven others surrendered before Judicial Magistrate Court here and secured advance bail even as Mr. Vijayakant moved a petition for anticipatory bail in the Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court. In disposing of the petition the Madurai Bench ordered that the petitioner surrender before the JM I, Thanjavur, and execute two sureties within 15 days from the date of receipt of the order copy and granted him bail.

The case relates to destruction of a banner bearing

the image of

Chief Minister
title: Vijayakant surrenders in Thanjavur court
